CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 28, 1961, pg. 1, reads: "PICKET CIVIC ARENA - Supporters of the Pittsburgh NAACP and the Negro-American Labor Council gathered outside the Civic Arena to protest hiring policies at the new amphitheatre, Saturday. The group, which included many local citizens active in 'fight for rights,' picketed and sang several choruses of 'Nearer, My God, to Thee.' - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Women and men, including Mal Goode and Jim McCoy, carrying picket signs inscribed "Why No Jobs, We Pay Taxes Too," protesting outside Civic Arena, with Lee & Sons Electric Wiring car parked on left
